benchmark_details.name: CVBench: Evaluating Cross-Video Synergies for Complex Multimodal Understanding and Reasoning
benchmark_details.overview: CVBench is the first comprehensive benchmark designed to assess cross-video relational reasoning rigorously, comprising 1,000 question-answer pairs spanning cross-video object association, event association, and complex reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of multimodal large language models (MLLMs) in cross-video understanding and reasoning tasks.

data.source: Videos curated from diverse domains including sports, life records, and artistic performances.
data.annotation: Expert annotated for complex reasoning and inter-video dependencies.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the percentage of correctly answered question-answer pairs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better model performance in cross-video reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance averaged 91.3%, while the best model achieved 69.4%.
methodology.validation: Dataset validated through rigorous quality control steps involving multiple annotators.
